id.description: A unique integer value identifying this IP address.

status.description:
The operational status of this IP

* `active` - Active
* `reserved` - Reserved
* `deprecated` - Deprecated
* `dhcp` - DHCP
* `slaac` - SLAAC

role.description:
The functional role of this IP

* `loopback` - Loopback
* `secondary` - Secondary
* `anycast` - Anycast
* `vip` - VIP
* `vrrp` - VRRP
* `hsrp` - HSRP
* `glbp` - GLBP
* `carp` - CARP

nat_inside.title: NAT (inside)
nat_inside.description: The IP for which this address is the "outside" IP

items.description:
Represents an object related through a ForeignKey field. On write, it accepts a primary key (PK) value or a
dictionary of attributes which can be used to uniquely identify the related object. This class should be
subclassed to return a full representation of the related object on read.

custom_fields.description: <llm-instruction>This part of the input schema is truncated. If you want to pass the property `custom_fields` to the tool, first call the tool `expandSchema` with "/properties/custom_fields" in the list of pointers. This will return the expanded input schema which you can then use in the tool call. You may have to call `expandSchema` multiple times if the schema is nested.</llm-instruction>
